d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:44): <bewest> Elazar: I happen to know it has the
d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:44): pardon
d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:44): this entity &#8217; is supported from the browser if i use like charset iso-8859-15
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:46): entities are defined in the DTD, it shouldn't matter what charset you use as far as I know
d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:49): i use xhtml 1.0 and the transitional dtd
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (22:53): hmm http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html#h-24.2 that explains things better
d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:57): then generally is recommended to use the entity character and not the equivalent numeric version
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (22:58): kioto: but browser support for numeric entities is more complete
d38c4ad54f855fb0a75d98da63b94d99 (22:59): yes in fact i have always you it
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (22:59): Except for very odd cases where the implementation of the behavior is in doubt (like &shy;) it doesn't much matter
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (22:59): But readability is good.
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:04): Is there any way I can getelementsbytitle in javascript?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:05): http://chino.homelinux.org/projects/getElementsByAttributes.html
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:06): b0at: Woah. Confusing. I'm gonna have to sit down for this one...
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:07): getElementsByAttributes({ title: COMPARISON }, document);, where COMPARISON can be a string, a regular expression, or a function
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:08): Could I just embed the code from his site?
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:08): e.g., save http://chino.homelinux.org/projects/getElementsByAttributes.js to disk and use it
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:09): Include it with a script element, and later in the document just use that function like normal
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:10): b0at: Can you walk me through something?
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:10): You're a Firefox/Opera user, b0at?
40d5ff31271cbdc9cb27402857c19c18 (23:10): is meta name="page-topic" important to have?

62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:13): page-title looks redundant. There's already a title element.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:15): The other two are theoretically useful, especially if you or someone else is indexing that content specifically
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:15): But if you're not going to use it...

a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:32): usually, it is best to avoid accessing the style object from javascript, and just set or remove classes from elements.

a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:34): yeeeah.
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:34): And I would change the image using getElementsByID, but the image doesn't have an ID.
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:35): and this is an exercise in what?
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:35): It's a dare. Some kid is trying to get me to change an image from spreadinterentexplorer.com to spreadfirefox.com
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:36): So what's wrong with that? Alert results and alert an element, see if it's what it should be (array and element object, respectively)
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:36): i think it is excessive.
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:37): Navigating the DOM based on position is more likely to be successful here than by attribute
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (23:38): Or, if img elements are scace, just grab all of them and modify the appropriate one
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:39): it is not like that getElementByAttribute code is implemented more efficiently. it likely scans all elements instead of just the img ones.
120561184ef924d394d0a396972a4e33 (23:40): noss, b0at: Well, do you guys have any other suggestions? I'm all ears....
a356ab67ed5f22602d4f3c3df1042ef9 (23:42): then you must look funny.
